alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 8:13AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Monroe, north central Baldwin, northwestern Escambia and southwestern Conecuh Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 813 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Stockton, or 17 miles north of Bay Minette, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McCullough, Uriah, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21 and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
